meanings.definition: The act of interposing or coming between
meanings.sent1: The interposition of the referee settled the dispute on the field.
meanings.sent2: The interposition of the wall blocked the view of the beautiful garden.
meanings.sent3: The interposition of the cat between the two dogs led to a comical standoff.
meanings.sent4: Her interposition in the argument was like a shield protecting her friends.
meanings.sent5: The interposition of the mountain between the two towns made communication difficult.

meanings.sent1: The glass was an interposition between the hot coffee and his hand.
meanings.sent2: The interposition of the curtain dimmed the bright sunlight in the room.
meanings.sent3: The interposition of the umbrella saved her from getting wet in the sudden rain.
meanings.sent4: The interposition of the tree cast a shadow over the picnic blanket.
meanings.sent5: The interposition of the book on the shelf made it hard to see the title behind it.
